required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Glucose Monitors to Regulate Glucose Levels in Type 2 Diabetics
clinical_study.official_title: Empowering Medicare Patients to Self-Manage Their Type 2 Diabetes Using Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) - Investigational Device Pilot

brief_summary.textblock: This study allows Type 2 diabetics to receive feedback from a continuous glucose monitor (CGM) as part of an educational program designed to help them better manage their glucose levels. Subjects will also wear an activity tracker to monitor their activity and observe its effect on their glucose levels. The educational program will involve calls from coaches to check subjects' progress and answer questions.

primary_outcome.description: (Number of patients who signed a consent form)/(Number of patients invited to enroll)
(Number of patients who complete 49 days of CGM use) / (Number of patients who signed the consent form)

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Average of Estimated Glucose Values (EGV) (Average)
secondary_outcome.description: (Sum of EGV for one week)/(Total number of EGV)
(dosage of Rx on Day 180)-(dosage of Rx on Day 0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Age of Participants Who Start Trial (Yrs)
secondary_outcome.description: (Sum of ages of all enrollees)/(Total number of enrollees)

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Age of Participants Who Complete Trial (Yrs)
secondary_outcome.description: (Sum of age of patients who complete)/(Total number who complete)

secondary_outcome.measure: Race of Participants Who Start the Trial (n)
secondary_outcome.description: Sum of American Indian or Alaska Native, Sum of Asian, Sum of Black or African American, Sum of Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, Sum of White

secondary_outcome.measure: Ethnicity of Participants Who Start the Trial (n)
secondary_outcome.description: Sum of Hispanic or Latino and Sum of Not Hispanic or Latino

secondary_outcome.measure: Texting With Coaches (Daily Average of Text Messages)
secondary_outcome.description: (Sum of all text messages)/(Total number of days)
(Sum of weekly coaching calls completed)/(Total number of weeks)

arm_group.description: Subjects receive a CGM and activity tracker as part of a educational program to help manage their glucose levels.

intervention.description: Subjects will use a CGM to develop an understanding of how their behaviors influence their glucose levels.
Subjects will use the activity tracker, in combination with a continuous glucose monitor (CGM), to develop an understanding of how their activity levels affect their glucose levels.

Coaches will help subjects understand the readings from the CGMs and how they are affected by diet choices, use of diabetes medications, etc. Coaches and subjects will have weekly conversations about CGM data and behaviors that affect CGM readings. Coaching will occur via telephone, text messaging, and automated text messaging.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be diagnosed with type 2 diabetes
- Currently take a DPP4 inhibitor, SGLT2 inhibitor, GLP-1 agonist, and/or basal insulin
- Be able to read and understand English
- Have access to a telephone
- Have a Medicare health plan
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Blind
- Deaf
- Currently receiving chemotherapy or radiation therapy to treat cancer
- Addicted to any drugs (including alcohol, painkillers, hallucinogens, or others)
- Critically ill
- Diagnosed with or experiencing:
- Kidney disease stages 4 and 5
- End stage renal disease
- Severe liver disease
- Dementia
- Schizophrenia
- Bipolar disorder
- Autism
- An intellectual or learning disability
- Arrhythmias other than atrial fibrillation
- Congestive heart failure
- Has had a:
- Myocardial infarction within the last 6 months
- Stroke within the last 6 months
- Stroke that resulted in significant disability (e.g., unable to write clearly or walk)

facility.name: Rogelio Machuca, MD Family Medicine, PLLC

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 364 candidates were contacted. Of those, 52 enrolled.

group.title: Diabetes Management Educational Program
group.description: Subjects receive a CGM and activity tracker as part of a educational program to help manage their glucose levels. Continuous Glucose Monitor (CGM): Subjects will use a CGM to develop an understanding of how their behaviors influence their glucose levels. Activity Tracker: Subjects will use the activity tracker, in combination with a continuous glucose monitor (CGM), to develop an understanding of how their activity levels affect their glucose levels. Coaching: Coaches will help subjects understand the readings from the CGMs and how they are affected by diet choices, use of diabetes medications, etc. Coaches and subjects will have weekly conversations about CGM data and behaviors that affect CGM readings. Coaching will occur via telephone, text messaging, and automated text messaging.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Program Enrollment Rate (%)
outcome.description: (Number of patients who signed a consent form)/(Number of patients invited to enroll)
outcome.population: 52 participants enrolled in the study. Hence, 52 participants analyzed. However, enrollment rate is the number of participants enrolled (52) divided by the number of candidates contacted (364). This explains why the Overall Number of Participants Analyzed is greater than the number Started in the Participant Flow.

reported_events.desc: AE and SAE were monitored in three ways: Participants were instructed to call the study doctor’s clinical research coordinator (CRC) to report all AE and SAE related to the study devices. Study coaches listened for any reports of AE or SAE in their communications with participants and connected reporting patients with the CRC. Reports of AE or SAE received by Dexcom’s Customer Care and Technical Support representatives were documented and reported to the Sponsor and CRC.

Activity Tracker: Subjects will use the activity tracker, in combination with a continuous glucose monitor (CGM), to develop an understanding of how their activity levels affect their glucose levels. Coaching: Coaches will help subjects understand the readings from the CGMs and how they are affected by diet choices, use of diabetes medications, etc. Coaches and subjects will have weekly conversations about CGM data and behaviors that affect CGM readings. Coaching will occur via telephone, text messaging, and automated text messaging.

event.description: Bleeding at CGM sensor insertion site.
Pain at CGM sensor insertion site

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
